election_record.label: New Jersey 1805 Assembly, Essex County, Special

overview.note: "At the late election in Essex county to fill the vacancy in the Assembly occasioned by the resignation of Mr. Darby, CHARLES CLARK, ESQ. (formerly in the Council) was elected without opposition." The True American (Trenton, NJ). January 28, 1805.

"CHARLES CLARK, Esq. is unanimously elected member of the General Assembly of this state for Essex County, to supply the vacancy by the resignation of EZRA DARBY, elected a member of Congress." The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). January 29, 1805.

election_record.reference: The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). January 29, 1805.
